concrete or asphalt: presence of cracks or fissures (ironically, the opposite of the crack you're trying to distinguish it from!)
possibly lines or markings from traffic or construction
may be part of a larger structure, such as a road or building foundation.
crack: a line or fissure in the surface
possibly filled with debris or vegetation
can be straight, curved, or irregularly shaped
may have a different color or texture than the surrounding surface
can be singular or part of a network of cracks
